meta.name: Sync New Subscribers from Google Sheets to MailerLite without Duplicates

name: Create and assign subscriber in Mailerlite from Google Sheet

nodes.name: Create subscriber and assign to group

parameters.content:
### Step 1: Manual Trigger üñêÔ∏è‚ö°

This node acts as a **Manual Trigger** to start the workflow on demand.

Why this step is important:

- üñêÔ∏è Allows you to control when the workflow runs.
- üß™ Useful for testing and debugging automation.
- ‚ö° Ensures the workflow only executes when you explicitly start it.

It‚Äôs the step that gives you full control to kick off the process whenever needed. üöÄ‚ú®

### Step 2: Get Rows from Google Sheets üìäüì•

This node uses the **Get Rows** operation to fetch data from Google Sheets.

Why this step is important:

- üìã Retrieves the latest rows of data for processing.
- üîÑ Keeps the workflow updated with current sheet entries.
- ‚ö° Serves as the data source for the rest of the automation.

It‚Äôs the step that pulls information from your Google Sheet into the workflow. üîó‚ú®

### Step 3: Get Subscriber from MailerLite üìßüîç

This node uses the **Get a Subscriber** operation to fetch details of subscribers from the MailerLite system.

- **Success Branch:** Subscribers that are already present in MailerLite.  
- **Error Branch:** Subscribers that are not found in MailerLite.  

Why this step is important:

- üîé Identifies which subscribers exist in your MailerLite list.
- ‚úÖ Allows the workflow to handle existing and new subscribers differently.
- ‚ö° Ensures accurate and targeted subscriber management.

It‚Äôs the step that separates known subscribers from new ones for smarter automation. ‚ú®üì¨

### Step 4: End Workflow for Existing Users üõë‚úÖ

This **End Workflow** node provides a safe and clean exit for subscribers who are already present in MailerLite.

Why this step is important:

- üõ°Ô∏è Prevents duplicate subscriber creation.
- üîÑ Ensures the workflow only continues for new subscribers.
- üßπ Keeps workflow logic clear and organized.

It‚Äôs the step that gracefully ends the process for existing users. üö™‚ú®

### Step 4: Create Subscriber & Assign to Group (HTTP Request) üÜïüë•

This node sends an **HTTP Request** to MailerLite to create a new subscriber and assign them to the required group.

Why this step is important:

- üÜï Adds new subscribers seamlessly into your MailerLite system.
- üë• Automatically assigns them to the correct group for segmentation.
- ‚ö° Ensures proper organization and targeted email campaigns.

It‚Äôs the step that grows your audience while keeping your mailing lists structured. üìß‚ú®

## Prerequisites ‚öôÔ∏è

Before running this workflow, ensure the following setup is complete:

### Google Sheets
- ‚úÖ Create and connect your **Google credentials** with both **Google Sheets** and **Google Drive** enabled.  
- ‚úÖ Your Google Sheet must include the following header columns:
  - **Email**
  - **first_name**
  - **last_name**
  - **Company**
  - **Country**
  - **group_id**

### MailerLite
- ‚úÖ Create and add your **MailerLite API Key**.  
- ‚úÖ Use this key in both:
  - **Get a Subscriber** node  
  - **Create Subscriber** node  

Once these are set up, your workflow can fetch data from Google Sheets and sync it with MailerLite subscribers seamlessly. üöÄ

main.node: Create subscriber and assign to group
